column16: Gundelia tournefortii is a PERENNIAL growing to 0.4 m (1ft 4in). The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy) and medium (loamy) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers  moist soil.
column19: Flowers: ,Leaves: ,Root: includes bulbs, corms, tubers, rhizomes etc.,Seed: includes nuts, cereals, peas and beans.,Stem: this often intergrades into leaves.
column21: The thick flowering stem, with the young and still undeveloped flower buds, is sold in the local markets in Jerusalem[2]. It is a sought after vegetable[2]. Immature flowering heads - cooked. Used like globe artichokes[177]. Leaves - cooked[46, 61, 177]. Root - cooked[114]. Seed - cooked[114].

column27: Prefers a sandy peaty soil[1]. Requires a sunny position and a well-drained soil[200]. Cultivated in Jerusalem as a vegetable[2].
column28: Seed - sow spring in a cold frame. When they are large enough to handle, prick the seedlings out into individual pots and plant them out in the summer. Division.
